comments:
Hi there,

Config overview: Eclips 3.1M5a with VE 1.0.2 (or 1.0.2.1.RC2) with jdk 1.5.0_01
on an AMD-64, 1GB mem, approx. 175 GB of spare HD space.

When creating a new (Swing) visual class or opening an existing one, I get a
message box that 'an error has occurred'. Looking through the error log, I see
various errors, most of them 'Exception Thrown' or 'Problems occurred when
invoking code from plug-in: "org.eclipse.ui.workbench' (see attached log details)

The .log file shows ClassNogFoundExceptions on
org.eclipse.ui.internal.commands.Command and java.lang.ClassCastException:
org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Tree. On earlier tries, I also got 'widget was disposed'
and introspection errors.

These errors occur whenever the Visual Editor is opened, making the editor
pretty much unusable.

There is no problem in 3.1M4 (using VE 1.0.2.1), so perhaps the problem is in
the platform, rather than in VE, but the VE category was my best guess.

Can you tell me if I perhaps have a config problem? I have already tried
reinstalling 3.1M5 from scratch, but to no avail :-(

Kind regards,

Rob van Wees.

.log content (one example per reoccurring error, the complete session file was
118KB size and growing)

--------------

Created an attachment (id=18452)
Session log file with VE property page creation errors

Rob, the property sheet viewer in VE 1.0.2 won't work on Eclipse 3.1M5 because
of a change Eclipse made. Please see bug 85012.
For now... until we move up to full support of Eclipse 3.1, I put a temporary
fix in VE 1.1 that will support both Eclipse 3.0.1 and 3.1. Please try out the
latest VE 1.1 nightly build N20050303.

BTW... there has been no testing or formal support of VE on jdk 1.5 yet... we're
still working with jdk 1.4.2 but feel free to take it for a spin.
Regards... Peter Walker

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 85012 ***
